            //set conditional assets for main.js
            var globalSiteSpecificVars = {
                pathToJquery: '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-1.9.1.min'
                ,googleAnalyticsIdsArray: ['google205af8501c1abd6c.html']//specify array of site specific id's NOT UCL generic UA-943297-1
            }
            if(cuttingTheMustard){
                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script> 

        <script src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/require.min.js"></script>
        <script src='//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLIndigoSkin/default-theme/main.js'></script>
        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

            </li>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG014 – Language &amp; Automation</h1>
<p class="p">This module is designed to cover a variety of topics concerning the use
of computer systems to present, manipulate, extract or translate information
expressed in natural (i.e. human) language. Areas likely to be covered include
machine translation, post-editing, controlled language and speech recognition. You will
acquire a basic understanding of the technology behind language engineering
applications, and learn to use and evaluate different tools and technologies.
Once again, this module has a strong hands-on focus.</p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term: 2<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Assessment: Report (30%); Project (70%)</p>
<p class="p">· Module Convenor: <a href="mailto:r.banos@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self"><strong>Dr Rocío Baños-Piñero</strong></a></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG015 – Localisation</h1>
<p class="p">This module introduces students to the specific context and
practices of localisation (software, website, videogames). The module provides
students with an awareness of how the localisation industry works, and which
processes are involved in a typical project. Students explore different
localisation features through a number of practical sessions. The objective is
to provide students with the practical skills necessary to develop further
experience in a professional localisation environment. This module
is not language-specific: it is taught in English and all the
activities are carried out in English. </p>
<p class="p"><strong> </strong></p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term: 1</p>
<p class="p">· Assessment: Project (100%)</p>
<p class="p">· Module Convenor: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/m.navarrete@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self"><strong>Ms Marga Navarrete</strong></a><br /></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>

                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras">Centre for Translation Studies</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">

            </li>

            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules">MSc Modules</a>

            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang017">TRANG017 – Professional Skills for Translators</a>
                
            </li>
        </ul>
    </nav>

                    <!--endnoindex-->
                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG017 – Professional Skills for Translators</h1>
<p class="p">This module
will provide you with the professional skills you will need to work in the
world of translation, both as a freelance translator and as an employee of an
institution or translation agency. Through a combination of lectures, seminars,
and project work, you will be exposed to prototypical situations you are likely
to encounter in your future career. The module will cover topics such as
translator ethics, project and client management, customer service, and
business skills. You will work on your own translation projects as part of a
team and receive constructive and relevant feedback on your performance.
Teaching will be interactive and feature real-world examples from many areas of
the industry. </p>
<p class="p"><strong> </strong></p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term: 2<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Assessment:
Project management portfolio (100%)</p>
<p class="p">· Module
Convenor: <a href="mailto:l.desilla@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Dr Louisa Desilla</a></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang018">TRANG018 - Audio Description for the Blind and ...</a>
                
            </li>
        </ul>
    </nav>

                    <!--endnoindex-->
                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG018 - Audio Description for the Blind and the Partially Sighted</h1>
<p class="p">This module introduces students to the fascinating professional practice of making audiovisual material accessible to people with sensory impairments. Students will learn about audio description for the blind and the partially sighted (AD). The areas covered include: legislation, history and present situation of AD, audio describing for children and adults, live versus pre-recorded AD, economic and professional aspects, and the conventions used on screen. Through a range of carefully chosen examples and exercises, students will not only develop confidence and skills in producing scripts for audio description, but also broaden their awareness about the needs of these people and of the grammatical and syntactic features of the language.</p>
<p class="p">Credit: 15<br />Term: 1<br />Assessment: 1500-word assessed audio description (written description only, no recording) and 1500-word commentary (100%)<br />Module Convenor: <a href="mailto:l.fryer@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Louise Fryer</a></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--None">
  
  <i class="fa None"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">UCL International Student Support</h2>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/iss" target="_self">Important information for international students</a></li>
</ul>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--None">
  
  <i class="fa None"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">Funding</h2>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/multidisciplinary-and-intercultural-inquiry/funding-studentships-prizes" target="_self">CMII funding information</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/scholarships/graduate/" target="_self">Graduate Scholarships &amp; Awards</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.grad.ucl.ac.uk/funds/" target="_self">UCL Doctoral School Funding</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ah/figs/wolfson-postgraduate-scholarship" target="_self">Wolfson Scholarships</a></li>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG019 - Subtitling for the Deaf and the Hard of Hearing</h1>
<p class="p">This module introduces students to the fascinating professional practice of making audiovisual material accessible to people with sensory impairments. Students will learn about subtitling for the deaf and the hard of hearing (SDH). The areas covered include: legislation, history and present situation of SDH, subtitling for children and adults, live versus pre-recorded SDH, economic and professional aspects, and the conventions used on screen. Through a range of carefully chosen examples and exercises, students will not only develop confidence and skills in SDH, but also broaden their awareness about the needs of these people and of the grammatical and syntactic features of the language.</p>
<p class="p">Credit: 15<br />Term: 2<br />Assessment: 100-word subtitling project and 1500-word commentary (100%)<br />Module Convenor: <a href="mailto:soledad.zarate@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self"><strong>Dr Soledad Zárate</strong></a></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG020 - Scientific and Technical Translation</h1>
<p class="p">This
module will prepare you to work professionally and reflectively in the highly
specialised translation market, providing you with the relevant competences to
translate scientific and technical texts. You will be introduced to scientific
and technical translation through lectures and language-specific, interactive
seminars. After an introductory session on the characteristics of scientific
and technical translation, you will be split into language-specific groups,
where you will translate a wide range of specialised texts belonging to
scientific and technical domains (to include popular science articles,
scientific journal papers, scientific reports, proposals, user guides, product
documentation, patents, technical specifications, etc.).<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term: 2<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Assessment:
Translation test (50%); Translation project (50%)<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Module
Convenor: <strong><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/f.m.federici@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Dr Federico Federici</a></strong></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG021 - Medical Translation</h1>
<p class="p">This
module will prepare you to work professionally and reflectively in the highly
specialised translation market, providing you with the relevant competences to
translate medical texts. You will be introduced to medical translation through
lectures and language-specific, interactive seminars. After an introductory
session on the characteristics of medical translation, you will be split into
language-specific groups, where you will translate a wide range of specialised
texts belonging to medical/pharmaceutical domains (to include patient
information leaflets, clinical trials, case reports, healthcare documents,
informed consent forms, pharmaceutical reports, etc.)</p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term: 1<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Assessment:
Translation test (50%); Translation project (50%)</p>
<p class="p">· Module
Convenor: <strong><a href="mailto:e.patiniotaki@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Emmanouela Patiniotaki</a></strong><br /></p>
<p class="p"><strong><a href="mailto:f.m.federici@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self"></a></strong></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                ,googleAnalyticsIdsArray: ['google205af8501c1abd6c.html']//specify array of site specific id's NOT UCL generic UA-943297-1
            }
            if(cuttingTheMustard){
                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script> 

        <script src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/require.min.js"></script>
        <script src='//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLIndigoSkin/default-theme/main.js'></script>
        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG024 - Subtitling</h1>
<p class="p">This module introduces you to Audiovisual Translation (AVT) practices in
general, and offers you an in-depth knowledge in the field of subtitling.
During the lectures and seminars, you will cover areas such as history and
present situation of subtitling, pros and cons of subtitling versus other AVT
modes, semiotics of subtitling, conventions used on screen, and economic and
professional aspects of AVT. You will develop subtitling skills in a variety of
registers and styles by translating texts and programmes of an audiovisual
nature drawn from various sources (films, corporate videos, documentaries) and
covering a broad range of specialised genres and media issues. You will produce
your own subtitles with appropriate subtitling equipment</p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term:1</p>
<p class="p">· Assessment: Subtitling test (50%); Subtitling project (50%)</p>
<p class="p">· Module Convenor: <a href="mailto:j.diaz-cintas@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self"><strong>Prof. Jorge Díaz-Cintas</strong></a><br /><a href="mailto:j.diaz-cintas@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self"><strong></strong></a></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang025">TRANG025 – Translating for Voiceover &amp; Dubbing</a>
                
            </li>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG025 – Translating for Voiceover &amp; Dubbing</h1>
<p class="p">This module introduces you to the professional activity of translating
audiovisual material for voiceover and dubbing. During the lectures and
seminars, you will cover areas such as the history and present situation of
revoicing modes in Audiovisual Translation (AVT), the conventions used in the
profession, common translation issues and strategies, and economic and
professional aspects of voiceover/dubbing. You will develop voiceover and
dubbing skills in a variety of registers and styles by translating texts and
programmes of an audiovisual nature drawn from various sources (documentaries, TV
series, animation, films) and covering a broad range of specialised genres and
media issues. You will produce your own translations taking into consideration
relevant conventions.</p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term: 2<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Assessment: Test (50%); Project (50%)</p>
<p class="p">· Module Convenor: <a href="mailto:r.banos@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self"><strong>Dr Rocío Baños-Piñero</strong></a> </p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang027">TRANG027 - Crisis Translation</a>
                
            </li>
        </ul>
    </nav>

                    <!--endnoindex-->
                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG027 - Crisis Translation</h1>
<p class="p">The module provides an overview of the multiple tasks that language mediators may be asked to perform in scenarios of crisis communication. The term translation here indicates any form of language mediation as deployed in crises – as opposite to discipline-specific terminology – and includes both written translation and oral interpreting as specific roles blur when evolving crises demand immediate responses with limited resources. The module will familiarize students with operational issues, existing aid technologies, and approaches used by language mediators in enabling communication in such scenarios as multilingual medical emergencies, disaster response units, pandemic information, terrorist and inter-operational response teams. The module delivers intensive training in supporting multilingual communication and peer-support in dealing with unpredictable circumstances, including operating in unpredictable language combinations. The module is driven by a problem-solving approach and is not language-specific. Discussions, role plays, and analysis of the constraints in ensuring quality of communication as currently documented in the literature on crisis communication will enable students to understand the role of translating in crises. The module will focus on ways of deploying automated technologies in order to diminish communication times in multilingual environments so as to have more time to assessment procedures that monitor quality of communication in crises. Currently, ad-hoc responses characterize most crisis translation activities; the ad-hoc situations will be contrasted with study of potentially coordinated and concerted forms of translation support as embedded in emergency planning. </p>
<p class="p">Term: 2<br />Credits: 15<br />Assessment: 2000-word scenario test (50%) and 3 hour technological test (50%)<br />Module Convenor: <a href="mailto:f.m.federici@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Dr Federico M. Federici</a><br /> </p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang028">TRANG028 - Translation Technologies 1</a>
                
            </li>
        </ul>

                    <!--endnoindex-->
                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG028 - Translation Technologies 1</h1>
<p class="p">The Translation Technologies 1 module is taught in Autumn Term (Term 1) and is a pre-requisite for Translation Technologies 2 taught in Term 2. The module enables students to master computer-aided translation (CAT) tools through presentations and practical seminars. Students are taught to use relevant software packages independently to perform translations into their first language and to assess functionalities of the applications from a language-independent perspective. Fundamental concepts, principles and workflows are introduced using specific translation technology tools. In addition, students become acquainted with the use of technology to increase efficiency as understood in the translation and localisation industry: The emphasis is on industry-standard translation memory functionalities such as Wordfast Anywhere and SDL Trados. Through hands-on exercises students develop an awareness of the use of translation technology in the industry.</p>
<p class="p">The module is compulsory for both MSc Specialised Translation students (all routes) and for MA Translation students taking the Translation and Culture route.</p>
<p class="p">Term: 1</p>
<p class="p">Credits: 15</p>
<p class="p">Assessment: 2 hour test (100%)</p>
<p class="p">Module Convenor: <a href="mailto:c.declercq@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Dr Christophe Declercq</a></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--None">
  
  <i class="fa None"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">UCL International Student Support</h2>
<ul class="disc">

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG029 - Translation Technologies 2</h1>
<p class="p">The Translation Technologies 2 module runs over 14 weeks during Spring Term (Term 2) and Summer Term (Term 3), due to the need for hands-on exercises and the time students need to digest information and learn how to use two different and complex technological tools efficiently. Mastering computer-aided translation (CAT) tools happens at consecutive stages, each taking a number of seminars based on problem solving exercises as well as tutorial sessions with guided activities overseen by the tutor. The module builds on students’ knowledge and skills acquired in the pre-requisite module Translation Technologies 1 (taught in Term 1). In Translation Technologies 2, students focus on mastering advanced features of the most frequently-used translation memory functionalities in industry-standard software packages such as SDL Trados and memoQ. Through varied hands-on experience students develop an awareness of the use of translation technology in the translation industry.</p>
<p class="p">The module is compulsory for MSc Specialised Translation students on the Scientific, Technical and Medical pathway and optional for students on the other MSc Specialised Translation pathways, and for MA Translation students. </p>
<p class="p">Pre-requisite: Translation Technologies 1<br />Credit: 15<br />Term: 2 and 3<br />Assessment: 2000-word essay plus supporting files (100%)<br />Module Convenor: <a href="mailto:c.declercq@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Dr Christophe Declercq</a></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>

            <ul class="footer__list list-unstyled">

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG030 - General Interpreting</h1>
<p class="p">This module
introduces different modes of oral interpreting, such as Liaison, Public
Service, Consecutive and Simultaneous Interpreting. Through lectures, seminars,
discussions and project work, you will be exposed to issues and challenges that
you are likely to encounter in your future career. You will also develop
preparation and note-taking skills. Topics to be covered include the code of
conduct, the role of the interpreter, cultural issues, and other elements
essential for professional interpreters.</p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term: 1</p>
<p class="p">· Assessment:
Portfolio (100%)</p>
<p class="p">· Module
Convenor:  <strong><a href="mailto:yoshiko.shimizu@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Ms Miko Yoshiko Shimizu</a></strong><br /> </p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG031 - Liaison and Consecutive Interpreting</h1>
<p class="p">This module is designed to introduce essential interpreting skills and
techniques in liaison, public service and consecutive interpreting that are
required to embark on a career as a professional interpreter in this particular
field. It aims to maximise your potential to become a professional interpreter
by providing opportunities to practise interpreting skills in various contexts
in specific language pairs. You will then reflect on your performance in order
to develop and improve your interpreting skills. The module is taught through
lectures, followed by practical seminars.</p>
<p class="p">· Credit: 15<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Term: 2<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Assessment: Liaison Interpreting Test (50%);
Consecutive Interpreting Test (50%)<br /></p>
<p class="p">· Module
Convenor: <strong><a href="mailto:y.shih@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Dr Claire Shih </a></strong><br /><br /><br /> </p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/html5shiv-printshiv.min.js'
                    ,'//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/respond.min.js'
                    ,'//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/respond.proxy.min.js'
                ]
            });
            //set conditional assets for main.js
            var globalSiteSpecificVars = {
                pathToJquery: '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-1.9.1.min'
                ,googleAnalyticsIdsArray: ['google205af8501c1abd6c.html']//specify array of site specific id's NOT UCL generic UA-943297-1
            }
            if(cuttingTheMustard){
                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script> 

        <script src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/require.min.js"></script>
        <script src='//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLIndigoSkin/default-theme/main.js'></script>
        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">TRANG099 – Dissertation</h1>
<p class="p"> Once the teaching finishes in May, you will spend the remaining part of
the course (to the beginning of September) researching and writing a
dissertation of a max. of 12,000 words in length. You can opt for a theoretical
or a hands-on approach and you will be assigned a supervisor. Among others, research areas
might include aspects of translation theory, translation technology,
audiovisual translation, corpus linguistics, specialised translation and localisation.</p>
<p class="p">Credit: 60<br />Assessment: Dissertation of 12,000 words max. (100%) </p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>

                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-audiovisual-msc">Specialised Translation (Audiovisual) MSc</a>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Specialised Translation (Audiovisual) MSc</h1>
<p class="p"> This MSc is designed to provide first-class training in audiovisual 
translation and accessibility to the media. The programme offers you the
 opportunity to develop your translation and language skills, to deepen 
your understanding of the workings of language as an essential tool of 
communication and to gain vital experience in the rapidly developing 
areas of audiovisual translation and translation technology.</p>


<h3 class="heading">Language Combinations</h3>




<p class="p">CenTraS offer the following language combinations for this pathway:<br /></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><strong>From English into:</strong> Arabic, Bulgarian, Chinese, Danish, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Thai, and Turkish.
</li>
<li>From French, German or Spanish <strong>into English.</strong></li>
</ul>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-audiovisual-msc/modules" target="_self">Modules</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View core and optional module information for this pathway. <br /></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-audiovisual-msc/apply" target="_self">Apply</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View entry requirements and find out how to apply. <br /></p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>


<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  <p>Sorry, this Silva Document is not viewable.</p>
</section>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">

  <i class="fa fa-envelope-o"></i>

<h5 class="heading">Admissions Officer:</h5>

</section>

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Specialised Translation (Audiovisual) MSc</h2>

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    

                    

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    <div class="middle-split clearfix">
                        <section>
                            
                                <h5>Entry requirements</h5>
                                <p>A minimum of an upper second-class Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a UK university, or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard, and proven linguistic ability in one of the language pairs available within the programme.<br><br>We can consider applicants to the MSc pathways intending to work from English into Arabic, Spanish, French, German, Japanese, Korean, Italian and Russian, and French into English until 15 July 2017. Unfortunately we are unable to consider applications for other language combinations for 2017 entry. Please contact Dr Federico M Federici for information prior to applying, f.m.federici@ucl.ac.uk</p>
                            
                            

                            <h5>English Language Requirements</h5>
                            <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
                            <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Advanced</strong></p>
                            <p>Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                        </section>
                        <section>
                            <h5>International students</h5>
                            <p>Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
                            
                            <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>

                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--application collapse">
                                <h3 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <h4>Applications</h4>
                                        <p>Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>
                                        <div class="clearfix">
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                                
                                                    <h5>Who can apply?</h5>
                                                    <p><p>The MSc is suitable for both practitioners and recent graduates looking to specialise in the fields of audiovisual translation, accessibility to the media and translation technology, as well as for those aiming for a research degree and/or academic career.</p></p>
                                                
                                                <div>
                                                    <h5>Application deadlines</h5>
                                                    <dl class="list--defined">
                                                        
                                                            <dt>All applicants</dt>
                                                            <dd>17 February 2018</dd>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </dl>
                                                    
                                                    <p
    on-error="string:"><p>Due to the highly competitive nature of this programme and the limited places available, offers will not be made until February 2018 at the earliest.</p>
<p></p></p>
                                                    
                                                </div>
                                                
                                                    <br><p>For more information see our <a
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
                                                    <a
    class="cta btn prospectus"
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGT (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-audiovisual-msc/apply'])">Apply now</a>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                                <h5>What are we looking for?</h5>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_1"><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p><ul><li>why you want to study Audiovisual Translation at graduate level </li> <li>why you want to study Audiovisual Translation at UCL</li> <li>what particularly attracts you to the chosen programme</li> <li>how your academic and professional background meets the demands of this challenging programme</li> <li>where you would like to go professionally with your degree</li></ul></p>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_2"></p>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>        
                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        <p class="zero-bottom">
                            Degree last modified on 3 October 2017 at 15:23 by UCL Student Recruitment Marketing.
                        </p>
                    </div>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Specialised Translation (Audiovisual) MSc</h1>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading">Core Modules</h2>








<h4 class="heading">Term 1</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang001" target="_self">TRANG001 – Language &amp; Translation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang024" target="_self">TRANG024 – Subtitling</a><br /><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang018">TRANG018 – Audio Description for the Blind and the Partially Sighted</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang028">TRANG028 – Translation Technologies I</a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 2</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang019">TRANG019 – Subtitling for the Deaf and the Hard-of-Hearing</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang025" target="_self">TRANG025 – Translating for Voiceover &amp; Dubbing</a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 3    </h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang099" target="_self">TRANG099 – Dissertation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/inside-the-translation-industry">Inside the Translation Industry</a></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading">Optional Modules</h2>





<p class="p"> Choose a total of two modules from the options below:</p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 1</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang015" target="_self">TRANG015 – Localisation</a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 2</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang014" target="_self">TRANG014 – Language &amp; Automation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang017" target="_self">TRANG017 – Professional Skills for Translators</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang020" target="_self">TRANG020 – Scientific and Technical Translation</a><br />TRANG026 – Topics in Audiovisual Translation (not running 2017/18)<br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang029" target="_self">TRANG029 – Translation Technologies II</a> (Terms 2-3)</p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>



<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <!--noindex-->

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Specialised Translation (with Interpreting) MSc</h1>
<p class="p">This MSc is designed to provide first-class training in specialised 
translation with interpreting. The programme offers you the opportunity 
to develop your translation, interpreting and language skills, to deepen
 your understanding of the workings of language as an essential tool of 
communication and to gain vital experience in the rapidly developing 
area of translation technology.</p>


<h3 class="heading">Language Combinations</h3>




<p class="p">CenTraS currently offer the following language combinations for this pathway:<br /><strong>From English into</strong>: Arabic, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Russian and Turkish.</p>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-interpreting-msc/modules" target="_self">Modules</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View core and optional module information for this pathway. <br /></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-interpreting-msc/apply" target="_self">Apply</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View entry requirements and find out how to apply. <br /></p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2016<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £9,020<br />Part-time: £4,510<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £18,670<br />Part-time: £9,285<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">

  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;

    var js = this.createElement("script");

  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 

<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-taught-degrees';</script>
        



            
                
                

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Specialised Translation (with Interpreting) MSc</h2>

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    

                    

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    <div class="middle-split clearfix">
                        <section>
                            
                                <h5>Entry requirements</h5>
                                <p>A minimum of an upper second-class Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a UK university, or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard, and proven linguistic ability in one of the language pairs available within the programme. <br><br><b>From English into</b> Arabic, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Russian and Turkish.</p>
                            
                            

                            <h5>English Language Requirements</h5>
                            <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
                            <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Advanced</strong></p>
                            <p>Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                        </section>
                        <section>
                            <h5>International students</h5>
                            <p>Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
                            
                            <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>
                            <p>Select your country:
                                <select
    class="country-select"
    onchange="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGP - international equivalencies', 'Dropdown menu', 'PGP programme page']);"
    name="secondHigher"
    id="prosp-equiv-specialised-translation-interpreting-msc">
                                    <option
    id="prosp-specialised-translation-interpreting-msc-default">Select a country</option>

            </section>
        
    
                        

                        


                        

                        
    
       
                        
    

                        


                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--application collapse">
                                <h3 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <h4>Applications</h4>
                                        <p>Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>
                                        <div class="clearfix">
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                                
                                                    <h5>Who can apply?</h5>
                                                    <p><p>The MSc is suitable for both practitioners and recent graduates looking to specialise in the fields of translation, interpreting and translation technology, as well as for those aiming for a research degree and/or academic career.</p></p>
                                                
                                                <div>
                                                    <h5>Application deadlines</h5>
                                                    <dl class="list--defined">
                                                        
                                                            <dt>All applicants</dt>
                                                            <dd>17 February 2018</dd>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </dl>
                                                    
                                                    <p
    on-error="string:"><p>Due to the highly competitive nature of this programme and the limited places available, offers will not be made until February 2018 at the earliest.<strong></strong></p></p>
                                                    
                                                </div>
                                                
                                                    <br><p>For more information see our <a
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
                                                    <a
    class="cta btn prospectus"
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGT (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-interpreting-msc/apply'])">Apply now</a>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                                <h5>What are we looking for?</h5>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_1"><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p><ul><li>why you want to study Specialised Translation (with interpreting) at graduate level </li> <li>why you want to study Specialised Translation (with interpreting) at UCL</li> <li>what particularly attracts you to the chosen programme</li> <li>how your academic and professional background meets the demands of this challenging programme</li> <li>where you would like to go professionally with your degree</li></ul></p>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_2"></p>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>        
                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        <p class="zero-bottom">
                            Degree last modified on 3 October 2017 at 15:23 by UCL Student Recruitment Marketing.
                        </p>
                    </div>

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2016<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £9,020<br />Part-time: £4,510<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £18,670<br />Part-time: £9,285<br /><br /></p>

            if(cuttingTheMustard){
                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script> 

        <script src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/require.min.js"></script>
        <script src='//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLIndigoSkin/default-theme/main.js'></script>
        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Specialised Translation (with Interpreting) MSc</h1>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading">Core Modules</h2>








<h4 class="heading">Term 1</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang001" target="_self">TRANG001 – Language &amp; Translation<br /></a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang028">TRANG028 – Translation Technologies I</a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang002" target="_self"><br /></a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang030" target="_self">TRANG030 – General Interpreting<br /></a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 2</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang020" target="_self">TRANG020 – Scientific &amp; Technical Translation<br /></a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang031" target="_self">TRANG031 – Liaison &amp; Consecutive Interpreting<br /></a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 3    </h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang099" target="_self">TRANG099 – Dissertation<br /></a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/inside-the-translation-industry">Inside the Translation Industry</a></p>





<h5 class="minor">Students must also take one of the following modules:</h5>

<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002">TRTPG002 The Interaction and Language Management of Interpreting</a> (Term 2)<br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG003">TRTPG003 The Historical and Social Context of Interpreting</a> (Term 1)<br /> </p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading">Optional Modules</h2>





<p class="p"> Choose a total of two optional modules:<br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 1</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang015" target="_self">TRANG015 – Localisation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang018" target="_self">TRANG018 - Audio Description for the Blind and the Partially Sighted</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang021" target="_self">TRANG021 – Medical Translation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang024" target="_self">TRANG024 – Subtitling</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002">TRTPG003 –</a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG003" target="_self"> </a><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG003" target="_self">The Historical and Social Context of Interpreting</a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG003" target="_self"></a> (if not already included in core credits)<br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 2</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang014" target="_self">TRANG014 – Language &amp; Automation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang017" target="_self">TRANG017 – Professional Skills for Translators</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang025" target="_self">TRANG025 – Translating for Voiceover &amp; Dubbing</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang027">TRANG027 – Crisis Translation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang029" target="_self">TRANG029 – Translation Technologies II</a> (Terms 2-3)<br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002" target="_self">TRTPG002 –</a><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002" target="_self"> The Interaction and Language Management of Interpreting</a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002" target="_self"></a> (if not already included in core credits)<br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG043">TRTPG043 Corpora for Translation</a></p>
<p class="p">It is recommended to choose modules that create a balanced timetable over each term.<br /></p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>



<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Specialised Translation (Scientific, Technical and Medical) MSc</h1>
<p class="p">This MSc is designed to provide first-class training in 
specialised translation in the scientific, technical and medical areas. 
The programme will equip you with the skills needed for professional 
work in the translation industry and for further research in translation
 studies.</p>
<p class="p"> You will develop translation skills in a variety of 
registers and styles by translating a wide range of scientific, 
technical and medical texts: scientific reports, popular science 
articles, peer-reviewed articles, healthcare documents, clinical case 
studies, user guides, and technical specifications, among others.</p>


<h3 class="heading">Language Combinations</h3>




<p class="p">CenTraS currently offer the following language combinations for this pathway:<br /></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><strong>From English into:</strong> Arabic, Bulgarian, Chinese, Danish, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Thai, and Turkish.
</li>
<li>From French, German or Spanish <strong>into English.</strong></li>
</ul>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc/modules" target="_self">Modules</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View core and optional module information for this pathway. <br /></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc/apply" target="_self">Apply</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View entry requirements and find out how to apply. <br /></p>

  </section>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 

<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-taught-degrees';</script>
        



            
                
                

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Specialised Translation (Scientific, Technical and Medical) MSc</h2>

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    

                    

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    <div class="middle-split clearfix">
                        <section>
                            
                                <h5>Entry requirements</h5>
                                <p>A minimum of an upper second-class Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a UK university, or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard, and proven linguistic ability in one of the language pairs available within the programme. <br><br><b>From English into</b> Arabic, Bulgarian, Chinese, Danish, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Thai, and Turkish.<br><br>From French, German or Spanish <b>into English</b></p>
                            
                            

                            <h5>English Language Requirements</h5>
                            <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
                            <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Advanced</strong></p>
                            <p>Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                        </section>
                        <section>
                            <h5>International students</h5>
                            <p>Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
                            
                            <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>
                            <p>Select your country:
                                <select
    class="country-select"
    onchange="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGP - international equivalencies', 'Dropdown menu', 'PGP programme page']);"
    name="secondHigher"

    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-UG">Uganda</option>

    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-UA">Ukraine</option>

    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-US">United States of America</option>

    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-UY">Uruguay</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-UZ">Uzbekistan</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-VE">Venezuela</option>

    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-VN">Vietnam</option>

    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-ZM">Zambia</option>
