    id="prosp-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc-country-ZW">Zimbabwe</option>
                                    
                                </select>
                            </p>
                            <div
    class="box--alt tagged country-select__content country-select__content-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc is-hidden">
                                <div class="tag tag--taught">
                                    <span class="tag__heading">International equivalencies</span>
                                </div>
                                <p
    class="equiv-content-specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc"></p>
                            </div>
                        </section>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </section>
        
    
                        

                        


                        

                        
    
       
                        
    

                        


                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--application collapse">
                                <h3 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <h4>Applications</h4>
                                        <p>Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>
                                        <div class="clearfix">
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                                
                                                    <h5>Who can apply?</h5>
                                                    <p><p>The MSc is suitable for both practitioners and recent graduates looking to specialise in the fields covered by the programme (e.g. scientific, medical, technical translation and translation technology), as well as for those aiming for a research degree and/or academic career.</p></p>
                                                
                                                <div>
                                                    <h5>Application deadlines</h5>
                                                    <dl class="list--defined">
                                                        
                                                            <dt>All applicants</dt>
                                                            <dd>17 February 2018</dd>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </dl>
                                                    
                                                    <p
    on-error="string:"><p>Due to the highly competitive nature of this programme and the limited places available, offers will not be made until February 2018 at the earliest.</p></p>
                                                    
                                                </div>
                                                
                                                    <br><p>For more information see our <a
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
                                                    <a
    class="cta btn prospectus"
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGT (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/specialised-translation-scientific-technical-medical-msc/apply'])">Apply now</a>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                                <h5>What are we looking for?</h5>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_1"><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p><ul><li>why you want to study Scientific, Technical and Medical Translation at graduate level </li> <li>why you want to study Scientific, Technical and Medical at UCL</li> <li>what particularly attracts you to the chosen programme</li> <li>how your academic and professional background meets the demands of this challenging programme</li> <li>where you would like to go professionally with your degree</li></ul></p>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_2"></p>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>        
                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        <p class="zero-bottom">
                            Degree last modified on 3 October 2017 at 15:23 by UCL Student Recruitment Marketing.
                        </p>
                    </div>

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Specialised Translation (Scientific, Technical and Medical) MSc</h1>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading">Core Modules</h2>








<h4 class="heading">Term 1</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang001" target="_self">TRANG001 – Language &amp; Translation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang021" target="_self">TRANG021 – Medical Translation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang028">TRANG028 – Translation Technologies I</a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 2</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang014" target="_self">TRANG014 – Language &amp; Automation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang020" target="_self">TRANG020 – Scientific &amp; Technical Translation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang029" target="_self">TRANG029 – Translation Technologies II</a> (Terms 2-3)</p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 3    </h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang099" target="_self">TRANG099 – Dissertation<br /></a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/inside-the-translation-industry" target="_self">Inside the Translation Industry</a></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading">Optional Modules</h2>





<p class="p"> Choose a total of two optional modules:<br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 1</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang015" target="_self">TRANG015 – Localisation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang018" target="_self">TRANG018 – Audio Description for the Blind and the Partially Sighted</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang024" target="_self">TRANG024 – Subtitling</a><br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">Term 2</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang017" target="_self">TRANG017 – Professional Skills for Translators</a><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang018"></a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang019">TRANG019 – Subtitling for the Deaf and the Hard-of-Hearing</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang025" target="_self">TRANG025 – Translating for Voiceover &amp; Dubbing</a><br />TRANG026 – Topics in Audiovisual Translation (not running 2017/18)<br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang027">TRANG027 – Crisis Translation</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG041">TRTPG041 – Translation Theory</a><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG043">TRTPG043 Corpora for Translation</a><br /></p>
<p class="p">It is recommended to choose modules that create a balanced timetable over each term.</p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Translation and Culture MA</h1>
<p class="p">The Translation and Culture pathway of the MA Translation enables you to focus on your practical language, translation and technology skills, with the option of studying an additional language, while developing a comprehensive understanding of the nature of translation. In this multilingual environment, you will build international networks and the language skills to enhance your employability in today’s multicultural workplace.</p>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-culture-ma/modules" target="_self">Modules</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View core and optional module information for this pathway. <br /></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-culture-ma/apply" target="_self">Apply</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View entry requirements and find out how to apply. <br /></p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>



<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-envelope-o"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Contact Details</h3>

<footer class="footer wrapper"> 
    <div class="footer__inner clearfix">
        


        


        



        <article class="block block--col-1">
            <h2 class="as-h5">UCL facilities</h2>
            <ul class="footer__list list-unstyled">
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/departments/faculties">Faculties and departments</a></li>

  }

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 

<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);

        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-taught-degrees';</script>
        



            
                
                

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Translation: Translation and Culture MA</h2>

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    

                    <div class="clearfix">
                        <b>Optional qualifications:</b>
                        
                            This degree is also available as a PG Diploma with fees set accordingly.
                        
                        
                        
                    </div>

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    <div class="middle-split clearfix">
                        <section>
                            
                                <h5>Entry requirements</h5>
                                <p>A minimum of an upper second-class Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a UK university or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard.</p>
                            
                            

                            <h5>English Language Requirements</h5>
                            <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
                            <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Advanced</strong></p>
                            <p>Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                        </section>
                        <section>
                            <h5>International students</h5>
                            <p>Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
                            
                            <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>
                            <p>Select your country:
                                <select
    class="country-select"
    onchange="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGP - international equivalencies', 'Dropdown menu', 'PGP programme page']);"
    name="secondHigher"
    id="prosp-equiv-translation-translation-culture-ma">

    id="prosp-translation-translation-culture-ma-default">Select a country</option>

    class="box--alt tagged country-select__content country-select__content-translation-translation-culture-ma is-hidden">
                                <div class="tag tag--taught">
                                    <span class="tag__heading">International equivalencies</span>

    class="equiv-content-translation-translation-culture-ma"></p>

            </section>
        
    
                        

                        


                        

                        
    
       
                        
    

                        


                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--application collapse">
                                <h3 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <h4>Applications</h4>
                                        <p>Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>
                                        <div class="clearfix">
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                                
                                                    <h5>Who can apply?</h5>
                                                    <p><p>The programme is particularly suitable for graduates with a language and culture degree who wish to develop practical translation skills in more than one language, along with an understanding of theoretical aspects of translation, for professional development or further research in this field. A sound knowledge of at least one language other than English is essential.</p></p>
                                                
                                                <div>
                                                    <h5>Application deadlines</h5>
                                                    <dl class="list--defined">
                                                        
                                                            <dt>All applicants</dt>
                                                            <dd>27 July 2018</dd>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </dl>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                    
                                                </div>
                                                
                                                    <br><p>For more information see our <a
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
                                                    <a
    class="cta btn prospectus"
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGT (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-culture-ma/apply'])">Apply now</a>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                                <h5>What are we looking for?</h5>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_1"><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p>
<ul>
<li>why you want to study Translation: Translation and Culture graduate level</li>
<li>why you want to study Translation: Translation and Culture at UCL</li>
<li>what particularly attracts you to this programme</li>
<li>how your personal, academic and professional background meets the demands of this programme</li>
<li>where you would like to go professionally with your degree</li>
</ul>
<p>Together with essential academic requirements, the personal statement is your opportunity to illustrate whether your reasons for applying to this programme match what the programme will deliver.</p></p>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_2"></p>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>        
                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        <p class="zero-bottom">
                            Degree last modified on 3 October 2017 at 15:23 by UCL Student Recruitment Marketing.
                        </p>
                    </div>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 


<h2 class="heading">Translation and Culture MA</h2>





<p class="p">The Translation and Culture pathway consists of 180 credits. The diet is comprised of a 60 credit dissertation, 30 credits of compulsory taught modules and 90 credits of optional taught modules.</p>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  

<h2 class="heading">Core Modules</h2>








<h4 class="heading"></h4>



<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang001">TRANG001 - Language and Translation</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang028">TRANG028 - Translation Technologies 1</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG099">TRTPG099 - Dissertation (12,000 words)</a></li>
</ul>


</section>

</div>


<h2 class="heading">Optional Modules</h2>





<p class="p">Choose a total of 90 credits of optional modules from the list below.</p>
<p class="p">CenTraS modules:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002">TRTPG002 - The Interaction and Language Management of Interpreting</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG003">TRTPG003 - The Historical and Social Context of Interpreting</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG008">TRTPG008 - Translation and the Web</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG009-10">TRTPG010 - Translation in History (15 credits, also available as 20 credit option)</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG041">TRTPG041 - Translation Theory</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG042">TRTPG042 - Translating Literary Culture</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG043">TRTPG043 - Corpora for Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang029" target="_self">TRANG029 - Translation Technologies 2</a> (15 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Language modules including Chinese, Dutch, French, German, Hebrew, Italian, Portuguese, Russian, Scandinavian languages, Spanish (two languages, up to 60 credits in total):</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG007" target="_self">TRTPG007 – Advanced Translation into Chinese</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/chinahealth/teaching/reading_translation_1" target="_self">HISTGC03 – (Chinese) Translation and Direct Reading I</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/dutcg502-advanced-translation-dutch-into-english" target="_self">DUTCG502 – Advanced Translation from Dutch into English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/frengt01-advanced-translation" target="_self">FRENGT01 – Advanced Translation from French to English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/frengt03" target="_self">FRENGT03 - Translation into French (Advanced)</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/undergraduate/modules/year4-2017-18/4th-year-modules-17-18/germ4001-translation-from-and-into-german" target="_self">GERMG032 – Translation from and into German</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/index_right/current-students" target="_self">HEBRG036 – Advanced Modern Hebrew, non-fiction</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/italg019-advanced-translation-from-and-into-italian" target="_self">ITALG019 – Advanced Translation from and into Italian</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/undergraduate/modules/year4-2017-18/4th-year-modules-17-18/port4010-advanced-portuguese" target="_self">PORTG001 - Advanced Translation From and Into Portuguese</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang_seesgr31" target="_self">SEESGR31 – Advanced Russian</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang_seesgr32" target="_self">SEESGR32 – Advanced Superior: Russian </a>(30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang-seesgr16" target="_self">SEESGR16 – Intermediate Plus: Russian (30 credits)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/scang001-advanced-scandinavian-translation-scandinavian-into-english" target="_self">SCANG001 – Advanced Translation from a Scandinavian Language into English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/spang019-advanced-translation-from-and-into-spanish" target="_self">SPANG019 – Advanced Translation from and into Spanish</a> (30 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Specialised Translation MSc modules (up to 30 credits, in addition to Translation Technologies):</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang015">TRANG015 - Localisation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang017">TRANG017 - Professional Skills for Translators</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang020">TRANG020 - Scientific and Technical Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang021">TRANG021 - Medical Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang024">TRANG024 - Subtitling</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang025">TRANG025 - Translating for Voiceover and Dubbing</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang027">TRANG027 - Crisis Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">CMII modules (up to 30 credits)</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/multidisciplinary-and-intercultural-inquiry" target="_self">Centre for Multidisciplinary and Intercultural Inquiry (CMII)</a> offers modules in African and European area studies, comparative literature, European thought and culture, film studies, gender &amp; sexuality studies and health humanities. </li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Optional modules are subject to availability and language prerequisites where applicable. It is strongly recommended to choose a balanced timetable over the two teaching terms. </p>
<p class="p"> This programme allows flexibility within certain parameters that need to be discussed with the programme convenor. Module selection needs to be approved by the programme convenor at the start of the academic year.</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                     <div class="content-sidebar">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-envelope-o"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Contact Details</h3>

<p class="p">Ms Amy Connolly<br /><a href="mailto:a.connolly@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">a.connolly@ucl.ac.uk<br /></a>+44 (0)20 7679 9323</p>



<h5 class="heading">Admissions Officer:</h5>



<p class="p">Ms Jo Wolff<br /><a href="mailto:selcs.admissions@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">selcs.admissions@ucl.ac.uk</a><br />+44 (0)20 7679 3096<br /> </p>


</section>

</div>

    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);

  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";

    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;

    dom = document.domain;

  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Translation Research MA</h1>
<p class="p">The Research pathway of the Translation MA in the Centre for Translation Studies enables you to focus on a specific interest in translation and intercultural studies under specialist supervision, developing superior research and writing abilities. You can also choose from a range of modules to enhance your language, translation and technology skills.</p>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-research-ma/modules" target="_self">Modules</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View core and optional module information for this pathway. <br /></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-research-ma/apply" target="_self">Apply</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View entry requirements and find out how to apply. <br /></p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">

        <script src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/require.min.js"></script>
        <script src='//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLIndigoSkin/default-theme/main.js'></script>
        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

        <script>

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Translation: Research MA</h2>

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    

                    

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    <div class="middle-split clearfix">
                        <section>
                            
                                <h5>Entry requirements</h5>
                                <p>A minimum of an upper second-class Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a UK university or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard.</p>
                            
                            

                            <h5>English Language Requirements</h5>
                            <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
                            <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Advanced</strong></p>
                            <p>Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                        </section>
                        <section>
                            <h5>International students</h5>
                            <p>Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
                            
                            <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>

    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-TN">Tunisia</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-TR">Turkey (including Turkish sector of Cyprus)</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-TM">Turkmenistan</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-UG">Uganda</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-UA">Ukraine</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-AE">United Arab Emirates (UAE)</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-US">United States of America</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-UY">Uruguay</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-UZ">Uzbekistan</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-VE">Venezuela</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-VN">Vietnam</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-ZM">Zambia</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-translation-research-ma-country-ZW">Zimbabwe</option>
                                    
                                </select>
                            </p>
                            <div
    class="box--alt tagged country-select__content country-select__content-translation-research-ma is-hidden">
                                <div class="tag tag--taught">
                                    <span class="tag__heading">International equivalencies</span>
                                </div>
                                <p
    class="equiv-content-translation-research-ma"></p>
                            </div>
                        </section>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </section>
        
    
                        

                        


                        

                        
    
       
                        
    

                        


                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--application collapse">
                                <h3 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <h4>Applications</h4>
                                        <p>Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>
                                        <div class="clearfix">
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                                
                                                    <h5>Who can apply?</h5>
                                                    <p><p>The programme is particularly suitable for graduates in a language and culture subject who wish to conduct an in-depth study of a specific topic in translation and intercultural studies and develop an understanding of theoretical and practical aspects of translation, for professional development or further research in this field. A sound knowledge of at least one language other than English is essential.</p></p>
                                                
                                                <div>
                                                    <h5>Application deadlines</h5>
                                                    <dl class="list--defined">
                                                        
                                                            <dt>All applicants</dt>
                                                            <dd>27 July 2018</dd>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </dl>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                    
                                                </div>
                                                
                                                    <br><p>For more information see our <a
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
                                                    <a
    class="cta btn prospectus"
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGT (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-research-ma/apply'])">Apply now</a>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                                <h5>What are we looking for?</h5>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_1"><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p>
<ul>
<li>why you want to study Translation: Research at graduate level</li>
<li>why you want to study Translation: Research at UCL</li>
<li>what particularly attracts you to this programme</li>
<li>how your personal, academic and professional background meets the demands of this programme</li>
<li>where you would like to go professionally with your degree</li>
</ul>
<p>Together with essential academic requirements, the personal statement is your opportunity to illustrate whether your reasons for applying to this programme match what the programme will deliver.</p></p>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_2"></p>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>        
                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        <p class="zero-bottom">
                            Degree last modified on 3 October 2017 at 15:23 by UCL Student Recruitment Marketing.
                        </p>
                    </div>

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>

<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>

<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Translation Research MA</h1>
<p class="p">The Research pathway consists of 180 credits. The diet is comprised of a 90 credit dissertation, 30 credits of compulsory taught modules and 60 credits of optional taught modules.</p>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>







<h3 class="heading"></h3>





<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  

<h2 class="heading">Core Modules</h2>








<h4 class="heading"></h4>



<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang001">TRANG001 - Language and Translation</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG041">TRTPG041 - Translation Theory</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG098">TRTPG098 - Dissertation (18,000 words)</a></li>
</ul>


</section>

</div>


<h2 class="heading">Optional Modules</h2>





<p class="p">Choose a total of 60 credits of optional modules from the list below.</p>
<p class="p">CenTraS modules:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002">TRTPG002 - The Interaction and Language Management of Interpreting</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG003">TRTPG003 - The Historical and Social Context of Interpreting</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG008">TRTPG008 - Translation and the Web</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG009-10">TRTPG010 - Translation in History (15 credits, also available as 20 credit option)</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG042">TRTPG042 - Translating Literary Culture</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG043">TRTPG043 - Corpora for Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang028">TRANG028 - Translation Technologies 1</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang028">TRANG029 - Translation Technologies 2</a> (15 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Language modules including Chinese, Dutch, French, German, Hebrew, Italian, Portuguese, Russian, Scandinavian languages, Spanish (one language, up to 30 credits):</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG007" target="_self">TRTPG007 – Advanced Translation into Chinese</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/chinahealth/teaching/reading_translation_1" target="_self">HISTGC03 – (Chinese) Translation and Direct Reading I</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/dutcg502-advanced-translation-dutch-into-english" target="_self">DUTCG502 – Advanced Translation from Dutch into English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/frengt01-advanced-translation" target="_self">FRENGT01 – Advanced Translation from French to English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/frengt03" target="_self">FRENGT03 - Translation into French (Advanced)</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/undergraduate/modules/year4-2017-18/4th-year-modules-17-18/germ4001-translation-from-and-into-german" target="_self">GERMG032 – Translation from and into German</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/index_right/current-students" target="_self">HEBRG036 – Advanced Modern Hebrew, non-fiction</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/italg019-advanced-translation-from-and-into-italian" target="_self">ITALG019 – Advanced Translation from and into Italian</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/undergraduate/modules/year4-2017-18/4th-year-modules-17-18/port4010-advanced-portuguese" target="_self">PORTG001 - Advanced Translation From and Into Portuguese </a>(30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang_seesgr31" target="_self">SEESGR31 – Advanced Russian</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang_seesgr31" target="_self">SEESGR32 – Advanced Superior: Russian </a>(30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang-seesgr16" target="_self">SEESGR16 – Intermediate Plus: Russian (30 credits)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/scang001-advanced-scandinavian-translation-scandinavian-into-english" target="_self">SCANG001 – Advanced Translation from a Scandinavian Language into English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/spang019-advanced-translation-from-and-into-spanish" target="_self">SPANG019 – Advanced Translation from and into Spanish</a> (30 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Specialised Translation MSc modules (up to 15 credits, in addition to Translation Technologies):</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang015">TRANG015 - Localisation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang017">TRANG017 - Professional Skills for Translators</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang020">TRANG020 - Scientific and Technical Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang021">TRANG021 - Medical Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang024">TRANG024 - Subtitling</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang025">TRANG025 - Translating for Voiceover and Dubbing</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang027">TRANG027 - Crisis Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">CMII modules (up to 30 credits)</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/multidisciplinary-and-intercultural-inquiry" target="_self">Centre for Multidisciplinary and Intercultural Inquiry (CMII)</a> offers modules in African and European area studies, comparative literature, European thought and culture, film studies, gender &amp; sexuality studies and health humanities. </li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Optional modules are subject to availability and language prerequisites where applicable. It is strongly recommended to choose a balanced timetable over the two teaching terms. </p>
<p class="p">This programme allows flexibility within certain parameters that need to be discussed with the programme convenor. Module selection needs to be approved by the programme convenor at the start of the academic year.</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-envelope-o"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Contact Details</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Administrator:</h5>



<p class="p">Ms Amy Connolly<br /><a href="mailto:a.connolly@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">a.connolly@ucl.ac.uk<br /></a>+44 (0)20 7679 9323</p>



<h5 class="heading">Admissions Officer:</h5>



<p class="p">Ms Jo Wolff<br /><a href="mailto:selcs.admissions@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">selcs.admissions@ucl.ac.uk</a><br />+44 (0)20 7679 3096<br /> </p>


</section>

</div>

    <nav class="breadcrumb clearfix">
        <ul class="breadcrumb__list">
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk">UCL Home</a>

            </li>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Translation Studies MA</h1>
<p class="p"> The Translation Studies pathway of the MA in Translation enables you to advance your practical language, translation and technology skills while developing a comprehensive understanding of translation in social, cultural and historical contexts. It brings together students from a wide range of languages and nationalities, generating international networks and the language skills to enhance your employability in today’s multicultural workplace.</p>
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-studies-ma/modules" target="_self">Modules</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View core and optional module information for this pathway. <br /></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    

<h2 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-studies-ma/apply">Apply</a></h2>





<p class="p"> View entry requirements and find out how to apply. <br /></p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>



<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">

  <i class="fa fa-envelope-o"></i>

<p class="p">Ms Amy Connolly<br /><a href="mailto:a.connolly@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">a.connolly@ucl.ac.uk<br /></a>+44 (0)20 7679 9323</p>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 

<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-taught-degrees';</script>
        



            
                
                

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Translation: Translation Studies MA</h2>

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    

                    <div class="clearfix">
                        <b>Optional qualifications:</b>
                        
                            This degree is also available as a PG Diploma with fees set accordingly.
                        
                        
                        
                    </div>

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    <div class="middle-split clearfix">
                        <section>
                            
                                <h5>Entry requirements</h5>
                                <p>A minimum of an upper second-class Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a UK university or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard.</p>
                            
                            

                            <h5>English Language Requirements</h5>
                            <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
                            <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Advanced</strong></p>
                            <p>Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                        </section>
                        <section>
                            <h5>International students</h5>
                            <p>Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
                            
                            <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>

            </section>
        
    
                        

                        


                        

                        
    
       
                        
    

                        


                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--application collapse">
                                <h3 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <h4>Applications</h4>
                                        <p>Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>
                                        <div class="clearfix">
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                                
                                                    <h5>Who can apply?</h5>
                                                    <p><p>The programme is particularly suitable for graduates with a language and culture degree who wish to develop practical translation skills alongside an understanding of theoretical aspects of translation, for professional development or further research in this field. A sound knowledge of at least one language other than English is essential.</p></p>
                                                
                                                <div>
                                                    <h5>Application deadlines</h5>
                                                    <dl class="list--defined">
                                                        
                                                            <dt>All applicants</dt>
                                                            <dd>27 July 2018</dd>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </dl>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                    
                                                </div>
                                                
                                                    <br><p>For more information see our <a
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
                                                    <a
    class="cta btn prospectus"
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGT (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/translation-studies-ma/apply'])">Apply now</a>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                                <h5>What are we looking for?</h5>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_1"><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p>
<ul>
<li>why you want to study Translation: Translation Studies at graduate level</li>
<li>why you want to study Translation: Translation Studies at UCL</li>
<li>what particularly attracts you to this programme</li>
<li>how your personal, academic and professional background meets the demands of this programme</li>
<li>where you would like to go professionally with your degree</li>
</ul>
<p>Together with essential academic requirements, the personal statement is your opportunity to illustrate whether your reasons for applying to this programme match what the programme will deliver.</p></p>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_2"></p>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>        
                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        <p class="zero-bottom">
                            Degree last modified on 3 October 2017 at 15:23 by UCL Student Recruitment Marketing.
                        </p>
                    </div>

                    

                
            
        
    
</html>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>

  <i class="fa fa-envelope-o"></i>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 


<h2 class="heading">Translation Studies MA</h2>





<p class="p">The Translation Studies pathway consists of 180 credits. The diet is comprised of a 60 credit dissertation, 30 credits of compulsory taught modules and 90 credits of optional taught modules.</p>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  

<h2 class="heading">Core Modules</h2>








<h4 class="heading"></h4>



<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang001">TRANG001 - Language and Translation</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG041">TRTPG041 - Translation Theory</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG099" target="_self">TRTPG099 - Dissertation (12,000 words)</a></li>
</ul>


</section>

</div>


<h2 class="heading">Optional Modules</h2>





<p class="p"> Choose a total of 90 credits of optional modules from the list below.</p>
<p class="p">CenTraS modules:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002">TRTPG002 - The Interaction and Language Management of Interpreting</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG003">TRTPG003 - The Historical and Social Context of Interpreting</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG008">TRTPG008 - Translation and the Web</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG009-10">TRTPG010 - Translation in History (15 credits, also available as 20 credit option)</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG042">TRTPG042 - Translating Literary Culture</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG043">TRTPG043 - Corpora for Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang028">TRANG028 - Translation Technologies 1</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang029">TRANG029 - Translation Technologies 2</a> (15 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Language modules including Chinese, Dutch, French, German, Hebrew, Italian, Portuguese, Russian, Scandinavian languages, Spanish (one language, up to 30 credits):</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG007" target="_self">TRTPG007 – Advanced Translation into Chinese</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/chinahealth/teaching/reading_translation_1" target="_self">HISTGC03 – (Chinese) Translation and Direct Reading I</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/dutcg502-advanced-translation-dutch-into-english" target="_self">DUTCG502 – Advanced Translation from Dutch into English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/frengt01-advanced-translation" target="_self">FRENGT01 – Advanced Translation from French to English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/frengt03" target="_self">FRENGT03 - Translation into French (Advanced)</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/undergraduate/modules/year4-2017-18/4th-year-modules-17-18/germ4001-translation-from-and-into-german" target="_self">GERMG032 – Translation from and into German</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/index_right/current-students" target="_self">HEBRG036 – Advanced Modern Hebrew, non-fiction</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/italg019-advanced-translation-from-and-into-italian" target="_self">ITALG019 – Advanced Translation from and into Italian</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/undergraduate/modules/year4-2017-18/4th-year-modules-17-18/port4010-advanced-portuguese" target="_self">PORTG001 - Advanced Translation From and Into Portuguese</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang_seesgr31" target="_self">SEESGR31 – Advanced Russian</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang_seesgr32" target="_self">SEESGR32 – Advanced Superior: Russian </a>(30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses/current-course-outlines/lang-seesgr16" target="_self">SEESGR16 – Intermediate Plus: Russian (30 credits)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/scang001-advanced-scandinavian-translation-scandinavian-into-english" target="_self">SCANG001 – Advanced Translation from a Scandinavian Language into English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/spang019-advanced-translation-from-and-into-spanish" target="_self">SPANG019 – Advanced Translation from and into Spanish</a> (30 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Specialised Translation MSc modules (up to 15 credits, in addition to Translation Technologies):</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang015">TRANG015 - Localisation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang017">TRANG017 - Professional Skills for Translators</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang020">TRANG020 - Scientific and Technical Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang021">TRANG021 - Medical Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang024">TRANG024 - Subtitling</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang025">TRANG025 - Translating for Voiceover and Dubbing</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang027">TRANG027 - Crisis Translation (15 credits)</a></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">CMII modules (up to 30 credits)</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/multidisciplinary-and-intercultural-inquiry" target="_self">The Centre for Multidisciplinary and Intercultural Inquiry (CMII)</a> offers modules in African and European area studies, comparative literature, European thought and culture, film studies, gender &amp; sexuality studies and health humanities. </li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Optional modules are subject to availability and language prerequisites where applicable. It is strongly recommended to choose a balanced timetable over the two teaching terms. </p>
<p class="p">This programme allows flexibility within certain parameters that need to be discussed with the programme convenor. Module selection needs to be approved by the programme convenor at the start of the academic year.</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Start Date</h5>



<p class="p">September 2018<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Mode of Study</h5>



<p class="p">Full-time: 1 year<br />Part-time: 2 years<br /></p>



<h5 class="heading">Tuition Fees</h5>



<p class="p"> <strong>UK/EU:</strong><br />Full-time: £10,140<br />Part-time: £5,120<br /><br /><strong>Overseas:</strong><br />Full-time: £21,160<br />Part-time: £10,740<br /><br /></p>


</section>

</div>


<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-envelope-o"></i> 
  

<h3 class="heading">Contact Details</h3>








<h5 class="heading">Programme Administrator:</h5>
