                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Translation Theory and Practice MA</h1>
<p class="p"> The MA programme requires a total of 180 credits. The
 core modules are compulsory and constitute of the required 90 credits. The other 90 credits can be chosen from the list of modules below, subject to availability and departmental approval.There may be certain language or other 
prerequisites for optional modules. Please note that some modules fill up very quickly, whilst others are sometimes withdrawn according to student demand, so places cannot be guaranteed.</p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">Core Modules</h3>




<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG001" target="_self">TRTPG001 – Translation Studies </a>

 (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG099" target="_self">TRTPG099 – Dissertation </a>(60 credits)</li>
</ul>
<hr class="rule" />
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    


<h3 class="heading">Suggested Modules</h3>




<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG002" target="_self">TRTPG002 – The Interaction and Language Management
of Interpreting</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG003" target="_self">TRTPG003 – The Historical and Social Context of
Interpreting </a>(15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG004" target="_self">TRTPG004 – Understanding and Using
Translation Technology I </a>(15 credits) </li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG005" target="_self">TRTPG005 – Understanding and Using
Translation Technology II </a>(15 credits) Please note: you can only take this module if you have previously taken TRTPG004</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG007" target="_self">TRTPG007 – Advanced Translation into Chinese</a> (30 credits) </li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG008" target="_self">TRTPG008 – Translation and the Web</a> (15 credits) **Not running 2016-17**</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG009-10" target="_self">TRTPG009 - Translation in History: Theory, Practice and Reception (20 credits)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/TRTPG009-10" target="_self">TRTPG010 - Translation in History: Theory, Practice and Reception (15 credits)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/dutcg502-advanced-translation-dutch-into-english" target="_self">DUTCG502  – Advanced Translation from Dutch into
English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/frengt01-advanced-translation" target="_self">FRENGT01 – Advanced Translation from French to
English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/frengt03" target="_self">FRENGT03 - Translation into French (Advanced)</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/ma-modules-14-15/germ4001-translation-from-and-into-german" target="_self">GERMG032  – Translation from and into German</a>

(30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/hebrew-jewish/prospective-students/postgraduate" target="_self">HEBRG036 – Advanced Modern Hebrew, non-fiction</a> (30 credits)<strong> </strong>Please note: this course has language prerequisites. <strong><br /></strong></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/chinahealth/teaching/reading_translation_1" target="_self">HISTGC03 – (Chinese) Translation and Direct
Reading I</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/italg019-advanced-translation-from-and-into-italian" target="_self">ITALG019 – Advanced Translation from Italian into
English </a>(30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/lifesciences-faculty-php/courses/viewcourse.php?coursecode=PLING151" target="_self">PLING151 – Linguistics of Sign Languages</a> (15 credits)
</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/lifesciences-faculty-php/courses/search.php?action=single&amp;coursecode=PLING150" target="_self">PLING150 – Sociolinguistics</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/scang001-advanced-scandinavian-translation-scandinavian-into-english" target="_self">SCANG001  – Advanced Translation from a
Scandinavian Language into English</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses-2014-15/current-course-outlines/lc_seesge94" target="_self">SEESGE94 –  Linguistic Methods</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses-2014-15/current-course-outlines/lang_seesgr31" target="_self">SEESGR31 – Advanced Russian</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses-2014-15/current-course-outlines/lang_seesgr32" target="_self">SEESGR32 – Advanced Superior: Russian </a>(30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/masters-courses-2014-15/current-course-outlines/lang-seesgr16" target="_self">SEESGR16 – Intermediate Plus: Russian (30 credits)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/prospective-students/postgraduate/ma-modules/spang019-advanced-translation-from-and-into-spanish" target="_self">SPANG019 – Advanced Translation from and into
Spanish</a> (30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang013" target="_self">TRANG013 - Accessibility to the Media</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang015" target="_self">TRANG015 - Localisation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang017" target="_self">TRANG017 - Professional Skills for Translators</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang020" target="_self">TRANG020 - Scientific and Technical Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang021" target="_self">TRANG021 - Medical Translation</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang024" target="_self">TRANG024 - Subtitling</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/centras/study/postgraduate-taught/msc-modules/trang025" target="_self">TRANG025 - Translating for Voiceover &amp; Dubbing</a> (15 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">If you wish to take any of any of the modules above beginning <strong>HEBRG*, HISTG*, PLING*, SEESG*</strong>), please contact the relevant departmental administrator in the 
first instance. <br /></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    


<h3 class="heading">Optional Modules</h3>




<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/comparative-literature/postgraduate/comparative-literature-ma/modules/clitg001-modern-literary-theory" target="_self">LITCG001 – Modern Literary Theory</a> (30 credits) </li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/comparative-literature/postgraduate/comparative-literature-ma/modules/clitg003-comparative-literary-studies" target="_self">LITCG003 – Comparative Literary Studies</a>

(30 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/dis/study/pg/INSTG017" target="_self">INSTG017 – Internet Technologies

</a>(15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/dis/study/pg/INSTG027" target="_self">INSTG027 – Principles of Computing and Information Technology</a> (15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/dis/study/pg/INSTG038" target="_self">INSTG038 – Electronic Publishing

</a>(15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/dis/study/pg/INSTG035" target="_self">INSTG035 – Systems Management
</a>
(15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/dis/study/pg/INSTG018" target="_self">INSTG018 – Introduction to Programming and Database Querying
</a>(15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/dis/study/pg/INSTG019" target="_self">INSTG019 – Legal and Social Aspects of Electronic Publishing</a>

(15 credits)</li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/dis/study/pg/INSTG008" target="_self">INSTG008 – Digital Resources in
the Humanities</a> (15 credits)</li>
</ul>


<h3 class="heading">Check the following programmes for additional modules:</h3>




<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/comparative-literature/postgraduate/comparative-literature-ma/structure" target="_self">Comparative
Literature</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/european-studies/prospective-students" target="_self">European Studies</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/european-culture-and-thought/prospective-students" target="_self">European Thought and
Culture</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/gender-studies/prospective-students/gender-society-and-representation-ma" target="_self">Gender, Society and
Representation</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/filmstudies/prospective-students/film-studies-ma" target="_self">Film Studies</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ssees/prospective-students/graduate-taught" target="_self">SSEES MA programmes</a> </li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie/" target="_self">Centre for Languages
and International Education (CLIE)</a> Please note: any CLIE module you select must
have a <strong>postgraduate module code</strong>. </li>
</ul>
<p class="p"> If you are interested in taking modules from the Department of Information 
Studies (codes beginning <strong>INSTG</strong>), please contact <a href="mailto:k.michaels@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Kerstin Michaels</a> in the first instance.</p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>
